title: Sinisa Mihajlovic back in dugout for Bologna tonight after getting 'all-clear' from leukaemia battle
text:
Bologna manager Sinisa Mihajlovic has been given the all-clear to return to the dug-out from his doctors following his battle with leakaemia.

Mihajlovic will rejoin his coaching staff on the sideline for Bolgona's Serie A encounter with Lazio.

The 50-year-old was diagnosed in early July and has received heart-warming support from everyone connected with Bologna and Serie A.

This morning, hundreds of overjoyed Bologna and Lazio fans took to the streets wearing t-shirts with Mihajlovic's name on in celebration of the news.

Bologna and Lazio fans in streets celebrating the news of Sinisa Mihajlovic's return

Lazio fans have shown incredible support for the opposition manager with t shirts and banners

Two fans hold a flag in honour of the Bologna head coach ahead of his return to football

He spent 41 nights in hospital, and has been unable to attend most of his sides matches so far this season.

'La Dotta's last two matches - a 4-3 win over Brescia and 2-1 defeat to AS Roma - Mihajlovic missed due to his chemotherapy treatment.

During his time in hospital, the Bologna squad parked their team bus outside his hospital room to chant his name while he was undergoing chemotherapy.

In a video posted on Twitter, Bologna players are seen chanting and waving at their boss

Bologna's squad pulled up outside the Sant'Orsola hospital to surprise their boss after a win

Sinisa Mihajlovic can be seen watching on from his bedside window as his players sing

The Serbian manager continued to influence his side from the dressing room despite being bedridden.

At half-time of Bologna's Serie A match against Brescia, Mihajlovic gave a rousing team talk via telephone from his hospital bed.

The team talk inspired an impressive comeback as his side came from 3-1 down, to win 4-3.

Bologna are currently 13th in the Serie A table, with six points from eight matches.
description: The Bologna manager has been given the all-clear from his battle with leakaemia and will return to the sideline after overwhelming support ftrom the fans and players during his treatment.
